wikipedia_page.main: Alfred George "Alfie" Hinds (1917 – 5 January 1991) was a British criminal who, while serving a 12-year prison sentence for robbery, broke out of three high security prisons. Despite the dismissal of thirteen of his appeals to higher courts, he was eventually able to gain a pardon using his knowledge of the British legal system.

response: * Alfred George Hinds – British criminal and prison escape artist who later used his legal knowledge to obtain a full pardon
*Alfred George Hinds, known as "Alfie Hinds", (1917–1991), English prison escapee

The issue of uncritical assessment of guilty plea is illustrated by the cases of Timothy Evans, Harold Israel, Marinus van der Lubbe, Albert DeSalvo, Jack the Ripper, Mata Hari, Renate von Natzmer, Danny Escobedo, Richard Speck, and Alfred George Hinds, among others.
